description: CMD-OS 1.2.1 (CMD for OpenStack) is an fix release of the Cloud Middleware Distribution. It includes a fix for cloudkeeper-os for CentOS7, and a new release of cASO for CentOS7 and Ubuntu.
releaseNotes: <ul><li>cloudkeeper-os 0.9.10 - fix dependency issue on CentOS7 (only)<br></li><li>cASO 1.2.0 - a bug was introduced in how records are retrieved with the introduction of the the "deleted" filter; this release fixes the bug, sites will need to regenerate accounting records; see cASO release notes for more details</li></ul>
installationNotes: All products in CMD-OS 1.2.1 were verified against EGI's current Quality Criteria. Installation and configuration notes are available in the EGI repository.
contact: "Contact Info": For further information about the distribution, its goals and surrounding processes, and more information about how to engage as a Technology Provider with EGI, please send an Email to: operations (at) egi.eu.
technicalContact: “Technical Contact Info”: For any bugs and issues you encounter that are not described in the release notes of this release, or the related documentation provided by the Technology Providers, please visit the EGI Helpdesk (<a href="https://ggus.eu/">https://ggus.eu/</a>) to make a report.
changeLog: This release fixes a dependency issue with cloudkeeper-os in CentOS7 (the Ubuntu version worked fine) and a bug in the previous release of cASO (sites need to regenerate their accounting records)

products.name: cesnet.cloudkeeper-os
products.description: Cloudkeeper-os is able to manage OpenStack cloud - upload, update and remove images and templates representing EGI AppDB appliances. cloudkeeper-os runs as a server listening for gRPC communication usually from core cloudkeeper component.

products.name: ifca.caso
products.description: cASO is a pluggable extractor of Cloud Accounting Usage Records from an OpenStack installation. cASO gets usage information from nova or ceilometer APIs and can generate valid output for Apel SSM or logstash.
